alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Muskingum (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COSHOCTON AND NORTHWESTERN MUSKINGUM COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 827 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hanover, or 8 miles northeast of Newark, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Drake, Cooperdale, and Dillon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
